result.execSummary:
The defendant Kari A. Bamberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Shall pay fine + costs + $15 pymt plan fee at rate of $50/month commencing 1/15/16 and 15th of every month until paid in full.
Failure to pay = 20 days DCJ w/h&t

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kari A. Bamberg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Gib Thompson.  DEF, Kari Bamberg apprs in person w/o coun.  Waiver to Atty filed/reviewed with DEF.  Wishes to con't w/o coun - so ordered.  PQWOR filed/reviewed with DEF.  DEF will be pleading to Ct 1 with Ct 2 to be dismissed/read in.  DEF enters guilty plea.  Court finds plea made FVKI and finds factual basis.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.  State heard/makes recomm.   Court reviews complaint.   Court heard/orders:

Fine of $200.00 plus costs
May set up payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing 1/15/16
and every month thereafter until paid in full - or 20 days DCJ
Defendant, Kari A. Bamberg in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. appears and heard; Def. wants to take State's offer; P&S set; bond cont.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

(12:59) Defendant Kari A. Bamberg in custody via video w/o counsel (declined SPD). Intern Kevin Schmidt (Tienstra) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD 9/9/15 at 3:30pm & JT 10/14/15 at 8:30pm in Br. 3; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety   and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
